fields.description:
A translation with a \n in it is causing UPM problems in German.


*Workarounds:*

*Option 1:* In Bitbucket Server go to "Administration" >> "Manage Add-Ons" and then upgrade the "Universal Plugin Manager" plugin version to 2.20.1 (or newest version available)

*Option 2:* Set the server default language to something other than German.
fields.summary: UPM doesn't work in German

fields.description:
The {{X}} element doesn't show a pointer cursor on hover and clicking it has no effect in browsers other than Chrome. 

*Workaround*

* Use Chrome to dismiss the banner
OR
* Restart Bitbucket Server to clear the banner
fields.summary: Unable to dismiss "plugins disabled" banner in browsers other than Chrome

fields.description: See cloned issue to see the example problem identified in 3.2.0, we'll revisit when we upgrade to a more recent version.
fields.summary: Issues with "My Pull Requests" when there are more than nine pull request entries

fields.description:
Although it is possible to add comments to a pull request, it would be nice if a comment could be attached to the approval/unapproval activity itself.

This would make even more sense when using the [Auto Unapprove Plugin|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/stash-auto-unapprove-plugin]. There is currently nothing which indicates that the automatic unapproval is automatic. An additional comment parameter in PullRequestService.withdrawApproval could be a way of making it clear to the end-user why the pull request was unapproved.
fields.summary: As a reviewer, I would like to be able to submit a comment when I approve/unapprove a pull request

fields.description: In Stash 3.11, the "Clone in SourceTree" dialog appears when the user has no SSH key configured, SSH is enabled, and HTTPS SCM hosting is disabled; and without any clone URLs available, the "Clone in SourceTree" button links to an undefined clone URL.
fields.summary: "Clone in SourceTree" dialog shows when no clone URLs are available

fields.description:
Stash 3.11 and Bitbucket Server 4.0.0, introduced a change in the SSH implementation where SSH clone URLs are not returned in {{RepositoryService#getCloneLinks()}} for anonymous users, causing plugins like the Jenkins webhooks to break. This behaviour will be reverted in Stash 3.11.4 and Bitbucket Server 4.0.1.

Additionally, Bitbucket Server 4.0.0 introduced a more complicated change in the SSH implementation where the SSH clone URL would only be returned if the currently accessing user had an SSH key configured, or if an access key was configured at the project or repository level. This logic appears to cause connection issues with FishEye and Bamboo, and will be reverted in 4.0.1.
fields.summary: SSH clone URL not being returned by REST and Java APIs called by an anonymous user or user without SSH keys

fields.description: Please do add ability to retrieve commits for a specific branch. Since and Until may not be feasible for all type of requirements.
fields.summary: Rest API function to retrieve commits for specific branch.

fields.description: The "Repositories" menu item is not shown in the User Profile tab.
fields.summary: Repositories tab nav item doesn't show in user profile

fields.description:
Hey Atlassians,

Could you please load Gravatar avatars over HTTPS instead of HTTP so we don't see mixed content warnings in browsers?

Gravatar says this:

{{Secure Requests
If you're displaying Gravatars on a page that is being served over SSL (e.g. the page URL starts with HTTPS), then you'll want to serve your Gravatars via SSL as well, otherwise you'll get annoying security warnings in most browsers. To do this, simply change the URL for your Gravatars so that is starts with:

https://secure.gravatar.com/...

Everything else is the same as above (all the same options work), just make sure that the URL starts out like this.}}

Thanks!
fields.summary: Load Gravatar via HTTPS

fields.description:

Stash 3.11.1 Issue Key at beginning:
!link-to-JIRA-2.jpg|thumbnail!

Stash 3.11.1 Issue Key at end:
!link-to-JIRA-4.jpg|thumbnail!

Stash 3.8.1 Issue Key at end:
!link-to-JIRA-5.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Keys not detected at the end of a branch name

fields.description:
When Stash:

1. has started but repartitioning hasn't finished running yet, or
2. is queuing requests (either hosting or command tickets are maxed out),

then the /status endpoint should probably return 503 Service Unavailable.  This would tell most load balancers to direct traffic to a different node.
fields.summary: /status endpoint should return 503 Service Unavailable if Stash can't serve traffic (hasn't finished repartitioning, is reaching resource limits, ...)

fields.description:
The current situation with Stash is:

Build status are linked to commits.
We can set an option to prevent pull requests merge action if there is not enough builds and if any build fail.
A single commit could be included in many pull requests, targetting different branches.


Core issues are:
* Sometime, you look at the status of the pull request, and you see the status of the last commit of the pull request. So status could be confusing for a user who care only about builds relative to the specified pull request and not the results of all the builds.
* We you set the option to prevent merge if there is not enough valid builds, and all builds successful, this option could prevent merging because of the result of a build that is relative to the same commit but to a different pull request targetting a different branch for example.

What we need:
We need to have a clear and relevant status. Could Stash propose a build status that return only the builds results that are relevants for the context? AKA:
* If you look into a branch, status on the commit in the branch
* If you look specifically at a commit, all builds results
* if you look at a pull requests, only the builds that are relative to the concerned pull request

We need also to have a trustable merge button, that prevent you for merging only if the builds concerning the pull request in question are broken, and ignoring the results of non relevant builds.

Regards,
Pierre
fields.summary: As a Stash user, I need contextualized build status so that a pull request could be merged even if builds not relative to the pull request are failing.

fields.description:
If I have created pull requests in multiple repos, I want a way to view all of them in one page/popup/etc.

This principle could be extended to be across multiple projects.
fields.summary: Ability to view all of my pull requests across all repos

fields.description:
When a repository has a large amount of branch permissions set on _specific branches_ (ie. not pattern or branch model type permissions), interacting with these permissions in any way can cause slowness. 

Interaction with the permission may be achieved simply by pushing to the repository, as this will trigger the branch permissions to be checked. 

Pushing a large number of branches at once to a repository with many branch permissions makes the problem more apparent.
fields.summary: Many branch permissions on specific branches cause performance issues

fields.description:
Hi,

2FA is a must nowadays.  Please implement.  I would suggest whatever Google Authenticator and Authy use (TOTP).

Please let me know if you have further questions in terms of requirements.  In a nutshell, I'd like to see:

1.  Ability for administrators to enable, disable or require 2FA for users
2.  This could be in the form of Google Authenticator-like time-based keys which the user can retrieve on their mobile/desktop device (or via SMS), or something simple like "security questions".  Ideally configurable.
3. This requirement should cover both UI and more importantly git operations through ssh.
fields.summary: Two-factor authentication (2FA) for Bitbucket Server
Horizontal scroll bar is missing in commit view
Many branch permissions cause push slowdowns

fields.description: The "user-and-group-multi-selector" component can be useful for add-on developers to use, it would be good to publicise and document an API for this component.
fields.summary: Promote the user & group selector component to the web UI API

fields.description: The Stash error message when failing to render markdown is "The markup for this file is too large to render." It should more accurately be "This product is incapable of rendering markdown once it exceeds some minimal size. Use a more capable product if you need to render more than a minimal amount of markdown."
fields.summary: Error message misleading

fields.description: There is a shortcut key for viewing tasks ({{SHIFT}}{{T}}) but none for creating a task.
fields.summary: Add shortcut key for creating tasks in Pull Requests

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to comment in a pull request +/-10 lines from a change. While that is sufficient in most cases it does prevent me from making comments like

"You forgot to change this piece of code...."

Suggest that you are allowed to comment:
1) Anywhere in the file with changes
2) even better In all files regardless of they contain a change
fields.summary: In pull requests allow comments on non-changed areas

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be beneficial to have predefined reviewers for branches, which is set per branch prefix (like develop-**). 

For example, a group named "developers", can be set as the default review group for all branches beginning with the {{develop-}} prefix. So, when a pull request is created from branch {{develop-001.00}}, which matches prefix {{develop-}}, the predefined group "developers" fills field reviewers.
fields.summary: In Stash when creating a pull request have predefined reviewer groups for branches based on the target branch name

fields.description:
This is reproducible with [Backup client 1.9.1|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.stash.backup.client] and Stash 3.11.2, but I belive it is not specific to Stash version.

*Repro steps*
# Take backup of Stash that is using external DB (e.g. Postgres)
# Create new home directory and new database (in Postgres)
# Run restore and override the properties
* {{java -Djdbc.override=true -Djdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/stash_restore -Djdbc.user=stash -Djdbc.password=password -jar stash-restore-client.jar backups/stash-20150910-161235-124.tar}}
# Go to newly created stash-config.properties (in the new STASH_HOME)

*Expected results*
Config file should contain new connection properties:
{code}
#>*******************************************************
#> Migrated to database at jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/stash_backup
#> Updated by admin 10T16:08:22.917+10:00
#>*******************************************************
jdbc.driver=org.postgresql.Driver
jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/stash_restore
jdbc.user=stash
jdbc.password=password
{code}

*Actual results*
The original connection block is commented out and new properties aren't defined.
{code}
#>*******************************************************
#> Migrated to database at jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/stash_backup
#> Updated by admin 10T16:08:22.917+10:00
#>*******************************************************
#jdbc.driver=org.postgresql.Driver
#jdbc.url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/stash_backup
#jdbc.user=stash
#jdbc.password=password
{code}

As per [Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/stash/using-the-stash-backup-client-533626909.html#UsingtheStashBackupClient-RestoringStashtouseanewlycreatedDB] new properites should be created.

*Workaround*
Before starting restored Stash home directory go to {{stash-config.properties}} and define new connection string.
fields.summary: Backup client > restore to a new database doesn't override jdbc properties in stash-config.properties

fields.description:
I would really like to see the ability to bulk select and delete branches in Stash.
Sometimes a lot of branches are left behind and to clean it up I have to delete 100 branches one by one. This can take a lot of time.
fields.summary: Bulk delete branches

fields.description: While diffs in Stash do have the option to ignore whitespace only changes, files that only contain whitespace only changes are still present in the diff file tree. This is inconvenient with diffs that include lots of files with many of them having whitespace only changes, as users would still be presented with all files and they would need to click on every one of them to finally realize that some files "contain no changes." It would definitely be nice if there was also an option to exclude files from the diff file tree or, at least, add some type of marker to these files (perhaps grayed out?) so that a user can easily tell if the file contains actual changes or it is whitespace only changes, therefore simplifying the diff/review process.
fields.summary: Filter out files that have whitespace only changes from diff file tree

fields.description: Would be cool if i could revert the changes of one file during a Pullrequest.
fields.summary: Pullrequest revert filechange

fields.description:
If a remote event consumer (JIRA, Bamboo, FeCru, etc) has a Base URL which does not match the URL used by AppLinks then _all_ remote events are dropped silently (i.e. a mismatch in JIRA will cause Stash not to send remote events to Bamboo, for example).

Consumers publishe via REST the event capabilities they can handle with their corresponding URL. Said URL is created using the application's Base URL. When that URL does not match the AppLinks URL the event cannot be sent and the error is not logged.
fields.summary: Remote events fail silently if Base URL does not match Application Link URL

fields.description:
Syntax highlighting for swift is not available in CodeMirror 5.3 which is the version being used by the latest release of Stash. However, swift syntax highlighting is supported in CodeMirror 5.4 onwards. 

Please update the CodeMirror version being used to support swift syntax highlighting in Stash.
fields.summary: Add Swift syntax highlighting support

fields.description:
Tested with Stash 3.10.2 and Bamboo 5.9.3

Stash only shows 1 build from the originating branch of a pull request, it never shows the right total.

# Install Stash
# Create a new Stash project and a Git repository
# Install Bamboo
# Create an application link to Stash
# Create a new Bamboo build plan with the new Stash repo as the linked repository
# Enable Plan branches in this build plan.
# On your workstation, clone the test repository and checkout a new branch
# Create a readme.txt file and commit.  Push to Stash.
# Wait for the Bamboo build to finish.
# Modify the readme.txt file, commit, and push.
# Wait for the Bamboo build to finish.
# In Stash, from "Branches" select "Create pull request" for the feature branch

*Result*
Stash shows 1 build total: [screenshot|https://www.evernote.com/l/AASP2tAW_b5O_4rCOqLIEP2uHMSEt3bHD4M].

*Expected*
There have been 2 successful builds in Bamboo so we should see "2 builds".
fields.summary: Stash shows the wrong number of Bamboo branch builds in pull requests

fields.description:
Tested with Stash 3.10.2 and Bamboo 5.9.3

Stash will never let you merge a pull request if > 1 successful builds are required.  It always thinks there has only been 1 build.

# Install Stash
# Create a new Stash project and a Git repository
# In Stash, configure the repository to require a minimum of 2 successful builds to allow a pull request to be merged.  [screenshot|https://www.evernote.com/l/AAR0LWDbVxNDv6QS7Hmr-_cO2NghKA3nbHw]
# Install Bamboo
# Create an application link to Stash
# Create a new Bamboo build plan with the new Stash repo as the linked repository
# Enable Plan branches in this build plan.
# On your workstation, clone the test repository and checkout a new branch
# Create a readme.txt file and commit.  Push to Stash.
# Wait for the Bamboo build to finish.
# Modify the readme.txt file, commit, and push.
# Wait for the Bamboo build to finish.
# In Stash, from "Branches" select "Create pull request" for the feature branch

*Result*
The Merge button is disabled with a warning, "You need a minimum of 2 successful builds before this pull request can be merged":  [screenshot|https://www.evernote.com/l/AAQexhFwoo9K2JxQo58eefEsQUl93p3zRs8].  Stash shows 1 build total (STASH-7799).

*Expected*
There have been 2 successful builds in Bamboo so merging the pull request should be permitted.
fields.summary: Stash does not allow pull request merges when more than one successful build is required

fields.description:
Currently, the /rest/branch-utils/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/branches REST API supports two operations:

* create new branch in repository
* delete branch in repository

In our workflow we often use third operation, updating branch in repository. This is not supported by the REST API now. You have to delete the branch and create new one is separated operations. This brings potential problems, branch is not existing all the time in repository, creating the branch again after deletion might fail, ...

Please, would it be possible to allow updating the branch in repository without deleting it? It's similar operation like tag update which is already implemented. E.g. the create method can have additional parameter allowing "force" creation of the branch (like the method for creating tags).
fields.summary: Ability to update branch from REST API

fields.description: Please implement code search in the project view that goes through all the repositories and branches
fields.summary: Code search

fields.description: Is there a way, to setup an application link to a CLI Skript, that uses OAuth to authenticate with stash? I keep getting: oauth_problem="signature_invalid". According to the docs, this is a problem related to the application URL, but my application doesn't even have an URL, since it is a plaing Command Line Script. How can I do this, without resorting to basic authentication using username and password?
fields.summary: How to user OAuth for Stash, from a CLI Application to make REST calls?

fields.description:
I really like the page you get when you browse an existing repository.  It goes through git configuration, cloning, and adding a remote.  All the information you need to clone, create, or add a new remote is right there and easily accessible.  The clone link is hidden in a menu accessed with an icon of three dots and I can't always see the entire Url, making it difficult to copy with a track-pad.  It also gives me more to explain when I am teaching others to use Stash.

I would like a way to make that empty repository page the default when going to a repository, or at least have a link to it on the browse page.
fields.summary: Optional cloning page for repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When installing Stash using the binary installer, a dedicated "atlstash" user should be created for the application service. This does not happen on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11, and instead the resulting application instance is started by the root user.

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Download and run the binary installer under SLES 11

h3. Expected result
- {{atlstash}} user created and Stash runs as this user

h3. Actual result
- Stash installs and runs as {{root}}

Note: See linked bug reports for the Confluence installer describing the same problem.
fields.summary: Stash Linux installer does not create dedicated user

fields.description:
If a Pull Request is created and there are non UTF-8 characters in the title or the description, the server may fail to render them as JSON objects. This is caused by Jackson finding incomplete/invalid UTF-16 surrogate byte sequences in the stream.

{code}
org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerationException: Incomplete surrogate pair: first char 0xdcaf, second 0x22
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.JsonGeneratorBase._reportError(JsonGeneratorBase.java:480) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator._decodeSurrogate(Utf8Generator.java:1702) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator._outputSurrogates(Utf8Generator.java:1657) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator._outputRawMultiByteChar(Utf8Generator.java:1643) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator._writeSegmentedRaw(Utf8Generator.java:809) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator.writeRaw(Utf8Generator.java:723) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]
        at org.codehaus.jackson.impl.Utf8Generator.writeRaw(Utf8Generator.java:691) ~[jackson-core-asl-1.9.13.jar:1.9.13]

fields.description:
If automatic merging is enabled in a repository, then when a PR is created and merged, send 1 email after the merge with the results (pass or fail) instead of 1 email for the merge and 1 email for the automatic merge fail.

If automatic merging is not enabled, then no changes.

fields.description:
With introduction of micro services there is huge number of repos for single project. So for a user story multiple pull request is issued for multiple team. 

It is tiring to search the pull request inside each repo.

Can you please introduce a page to list all pull request irrespective of repo's and also a search or sorting option to search the pull request. 

Ping me in padma.priya@adp.com for more clarifications.

Make shift+enter go backward while searching across a file.

fields.description:
For project that have (unfortunately) a mix of tabs and spaces, and while attempting to enforce all new code following a single approach, it would be helpful if the code viewer in stash could show whitespace (dots for spaces, arrows for tabs, etc) as many code editors have this option.

This should be a separate setting from the "ignore whitespace" setting, possibly at the personal profile level, but could be toggled while viewing code, as well.
fields.summary: Ability to view spaces vs tabs in the code viewer

fields.description:
When I try to delete a branch in stash repository, It fails saying "An error occurred while processing the request. Check the server logs for more information."

But there is nothing in the server log.

fields.description: Currently, pull request email notifications display commit dates using relative time (e.g., "3 mins ago"). This isn't very useful since the email may be opened at any time in the future. Instead, time should be displayed in absolute terms in static contexts like email.

fields.description:
On [Bamboo integration (Stash Space)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Bamboo+integration], [Integrating Bamboo with Stash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/integrating-bamboo-with-stash-289276959.html#IntegratingBamboowithStash-Configuration] and [Bamboo integration (Bamboo Space)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+Stash] we don't call out an important restriction: in order for the Stash repos check outs from Bamboo to work using the Application Links, Stash _must have_ SSH enabled.

This fact has been called out by our customers on the links below and we should fix our documentation to highlight that:
- BAM-15464
- [Cannot add a Stash Repository in Bamboo without SSH|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24648556/comments/24648719]
fields.summary: Bamboo and Stash restriction while adding a new repo

fields.description:
When HTTPS repository access is disabled and the currently logged in user has no SSH key uploaded, the clone dialog shows: `git clone undefined`.

Very minor issue but I thought it was worth reporting.
fields.summary: Git clone url shows "undefined" when no SSH key is added

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If [HTTP(S) is disabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Disabling+HTTP%28S%29+access+to+Git+repositories+in+Stash] and SSH is enabled in the "Server" settings, the clone URL is displayed as "git clone undefined" when creating a new repository.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Under {{Administration -> Server -> HTTP(S) SCM hosting}}, uncheck the "HTTP(S) enabled" checkbox.
# Under {{Administration -> Server -> SSH access}}, check the "SSH enabled" and "SSH access keys" checkboxes. No SSH user keys have been added at this point.
# Create a new repository

h3. Expected Results
The "I just want to clone this repository" displays the correct clone URL
h3. Actual Results
The "I just want to clone this repository" displays "git clone undefined"
 
h3. Notes
This message should be instead changed to give better information to the user about the missing [SSH user keys|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/SSH+user+keys+for+personal+use].

h3.Workaround
Add [SSH user keys|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/SSH+user+keys+for+personal+use]
fields.summary: "git clone undefined" when HTTP(S) is disabled and current user has no SSH keys

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA you can have relationships between tickets. One can block, or depend, or simply is related to another ticket. Pull requests in Stash should be capable of the same. I should be able to create a parent pull request 'group' or 'cluster' of different pull requests and define relationships between those children. 

Additionally if different pull requests have the same name, aka repo_a feature/new_awesome and repo_b feature/new_awesome, they should automatically group themselves (Or offer it as an option to the reviewers/Merge manager). 

Lastly, potentially if there are relationships defined between JIRA tickets (DEV-566 is blocked by DEV-555) and you are submitting pull requests for both, it seems that that relationship should follow the pull requests too. This should at least notify the merge manager of an order to merge the features (or reject them) so that your CI server build doesn't fail when Part B is merged before Part A.
fields.summary: Add relationships to pull requests

fields.description:
For example, say I want to create a new branch branching from "release".
I type "release" into the branch picker ...

... and now I have to scroll through pages and pages of 

!attachment-name.jpg|thumbnail!

Until I finally find "release" ... yes, hard to beleive, but thats the one I wanted!

Making it worse, I can't just hit enter and say "really, give me 'release' - I know what I am doing" - I am forced to actually select the correct value in the drop-down.
fields.summary: Searching branches should give priority to exact matches

fields.description:
If a create a branch B by branching from existing branch A, and then later create a PR on B, I probably want to merge back to A.

Currently Stash offers me to merge back to master by default - we can be smarter than that.
fields.summary: When Stash creates a branch, remember where we branched from for when I open a PR

fields.description: I am unable to see the upper most reviewer of a PR if there are a bunch of people assigned to it.
fields.summary: UI bug: Can't fully see the top-most reviewer at the top of the list on a PR if there are a bunch of people assigned.

fields.description:
When the errors from a pre-receive hook are > 65535 characters and contains non-ASCII characters, Stash logs a java.io.UTFDataFormatException rather than returning the error to the user.

I think that the issue is that one of the error messages that is going to be presented contains non-ASCII, which may be affecting how stash calculates the length of the string:

2015-05-14 17:38:51,253 DEBUG [threadpool:thread-1] admin 1058x428x0 9jdq8q 127.0.0.1 "POST /scm/project_1/tcollector.git/git-receive-pack HTTP/1.1" com.isroot.stash.plugin.YaccHook error: refs/heads/master: 4ab418df78b7bbfe1d7c8223f59b82537352d6a1: expected committer name 'Administrator' but found 'Ulrik Holmén'

This can be 'fixed' by running:

git filter-branch -f --env-filter '
if [ "$GIT_AUTHOR_NAME" = "Ulrik Holmén" ]
then
export GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="Ulrik Holmen"
fi
if [ "$GIT_COMMITTER_NAME" = "Ulrik Holmén" ]
then
export GIT_COMMITTER_NAME="Ulrik Holmen"
fi
'
which supports this being a UTF8/ASCII issue

To reproduce (note that this is just to reproduce, but its not related to the plugin, just the error that the plugin generates)

* Install the 'yet-another-commit-checker' plugin
* Enable the hook on a repo, with the 'Require Matching Committer Email' and 'Require Matching Committer Name' options enabled
* Try to push a repository with lots of commits that won't match, including a non-ASCII committer, ie:
** git clone https://github.com/OpenTSDB/tcollector.git
** git remote set-url http://localhost:7990/stash/scm/test/tcollector.git
** git push

Expected results: A lot of errors about the commits not matching

Actual results:

$ git push
Counting objects: 1614, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (766/766), done.
Writing objects: 100% (1614/1614), 542.72 KiB | 0 bytes/s, done.
Total 1614 (delta 824), reused 1614 (delta 824)
remote: Communication breakdown with Stash.
To http://admin@localhost:7990/stash/scm/test/tcollector.git
 ! [remote rejected] master -> master (pre-receive hook declined)
error: failed to push some refs to 'http://admin@localhost:7990/stash/scm/test/tcollector.git'

and a stacktrace in the Stash logs:

java.io.UTFDataFormatException: encoded string too long: 65538 bytes
        at java.io.DataOutputStream.writeUTF(DataOutputStream.java:364) ~[na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.io.DataOutputStream.writeUTF(DataOutputStream.java:323) ~[na:1.7.0_45]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hook.SocketTransferOutput.writeInChunks(SocketTransferOutput.java:58) ~[SocketTransferOutput.class:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hook.SocketTransferOutput.writeStdErr(SocketTransferOutput.java:46) ~[SocketTransferOutput.class:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hook.DefaultHookService.writeResponse(DefaultHookService.java:320) ~[DefaultHookService.class:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hook.DefaultHookService.handleRawRequest(DefaultHookService.java:249) ~[DefaultHookService.class:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.hook.DefaultHookService$2$1.run(DefaultHookService.java:205) [DefaultHookService$2$1.class:na]
        at com.atlassian.stash.internal.concurrent.StateTransferringExecutor$StateTransferringRunnable.run(StateTransferringExecutor.java:73) [StateTransferringExecutor$StateTransferringRunnable.class:na]
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471) [na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262) [na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:178) [na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:292) [na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145) [na:1.7.0_45]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744) [na:1.7.0_45]
        ... 1 frame trimmed

fields.description: Currently, Stash has no way to display a list of tags along with their creation date, description, etc.  It would be useful to have such a list - especially if it could be filtered as the branch lists can.
fields.summary: Add tag list & filtering abilities

fields.description:
We use the google/android "repo" utility to manage the set of git repositories needed for our product.  

When using "repo sync"  with the -j (parallel) option, repo opens one SSH connection with the ControlMaster option, then multiplexes SSH sessions used to fetch/update each git repository over that connection rather than establishing a new connection for each fetch. This is to avoid SSH handshake overhead.

However, since updating from 3.4 to 3.11.2 last week, we've had intermittent sync failures in our CI builds, with errors like this:

{quote}
repo has been initialized in /data/build-eqx-02.2/xml-data/build-dir/XXXXX
Write failed: Broken pipe
mux_client_request_session: read from master failed: Broken pipe
mux_client_request_session: read from master failed: Broken pipe
mux_client_request_session: read from master failed: Broken pipe
mux_client_request_session: read from master failed: Broken pipe
fatal: The remote end hung up upon initial contact
{quote}

In other cases, the repo sync eventually succeeded, but took an hour where it normally would have been complete in a few minutes.

The sync-j option in repo's default.xml is set to 8, Stash's throttle.resource.scm-hosting is set to 8, and our build plan has 4 variants. So while there is over-subscription, as the CI build alone could result in 32 simultaneous fetches, Stash's throttling should handle this.

One reason I suspect a problem with Stash's SSH multiplexing is that yesterday we changed the CI build plan to set the GIT_SSH environment variable to "ssh" before invoking repo sync to disable multiplexing.  We haven't seen this issue since.
fields.summary: Problem with SSH multiplexing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"*Returing*"

h3. Expected Results

_The application is unavailable, or there are errors.  *Returning* a temporarily unavailable status._

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-stash.log file & the date stamped logs:

{noformat}
2015-08-24 06:33:54,709 INFO  [http-bio-80-exec-55588] @19RGGT6x393x2836499x0 10.87.53.203 "GET /scm/mdp/smart.etl-qaservice.git/info/refs HTTP/1.1" c.a.johnson.filters.Johnson503Filter The application is unavailable, or there are errors.  Returing a temporarily unavailable status.
2015-08-24 06:33:54,818 INFO  [NioProcessor-2]  c.a.s.i.s.s.StashPublicKeyAuthenticator SSH client refused because Stash is currently under maintenance.
2015-08-24 06:33:55,801 INFO  [http-bio-80-exec-55747] @19RGGT6x393x2836505x0 10.86.210.37 "GET /scm/risk/rwe.glori.runtime.git/info/refs HTTP/1.1" c.a.johnson.filters.Johnson503Filter The application is unavailable, or there are errors.  Returing a temporarily unavailable status.

fields.description:
Currently, tasks added to a pull request (added in STASH-3781) are just plain text. It would be really to add markdown rendering.

I'd like to be able to say things like "Make this consistent with the `foo.bar` method" and see foo.bar rendered as code.
fields.summary: Render tasks as markdown

fields.description:
The branch permissions REST API feels fragmented. 
Parts of the functionality are provided only in the 1.0 API and others only in 2.0
Adding and removing users and groups to/from permissions is also too difficult.  

Make the REST API consistent and more efficient please.
fields.summary: Improve the branch permissions REST API

fields.description:
This issue is related to STASH-7597. Very similar problem, where the following situation occurs:

Let's say we have branch with name dev/8000.

Repository has the following branch restriction:
dev/8000
Prevent rewriting history	
Prevent branch deletion	

dev/
Prevent rewriting history	
Prevent branch deletion	
Prevent changes without a pull request

Expected behavior for pushing w/o pull request to dev/8000 is to allow the push, but instead it errors out with message:

remote: Branch refs/heads/dev/8000 can only be modified through pull requests.
remote: Check your branch permissions configuration with the project administrator.
fields.summary: Branch Permissions "Prevent changes without a pull request" Restriction should not prevent push if multiple Restrictions match the target branch, and at least one allows changes without a pull request

fields.description: The create pull request and create branch links is available under actions currently. It would be better if the create pull request and create branch is provided at the top of pull requests and branches page respectively
fields.summary: Links to create pull request and branch under pull requests and branches tab respectively

fields.description:
Stash hijacks the default keyboard shortcut to search for text, and replaces the built in search functionality of the browser, which is performant and good, with one implemented in javascript which is slow, unnecessary and behaves unexpectedly (e.g. searching, clicking, then searching again)

This creates a lot of irritation and distraction when reviewing code.

Some possible resolutions:
* Change keyboard shortcut to something other than Ctrl-F
* User setting to activate/deactivate feature
fields.summary: Stash hijacks Ctrl-F

fields.description: The Chrome print dialog uses ctrl+shift+P and is triggered on keydown (and thus pre-empts our handling). Moving our handling to keydown would allow us to pre-empt it back.
fields.summary: Ctrl+Shift+P shortcut fails on Chrome Windows

fields.description:
As a system administrator, it should be easier to install SSL chains and certificates into Stash (Tomcat/Java). This should be available to the user interface.

This would stop errors where a service contacted by Stash is using self signed or non-chained certificates (such as self hosted JIRA, Confluence, or other services) which are running on certificates which can't be validated in the wild but are trusted by the admin.
fields.summary: Add user interface for adding SSL chains and certificates to the trusted list.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24647270/answers/24654503

Our JS for the compare page hardcodes the first two tabs, and there is no way for another tab to inject itself into the mix. The best that can be done is to write JS that fights with our tab changing JS to assert itself.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Make a pull request from a personal repository fork to the main repository, look at the diff, and then click the source button for one of the files for the diff. Instead of leading to the source file in the personal project, it leads you to the source of the main project which is incorrect. It should be leading you to the personal project.

Another thing to note is that instead of showing the branch in the url or as the selected branch, it shows a commit ref which is confusing. It should really be showing the branch that I'm on.
fields.summary: Stash source button in Pull Request leads to incorrect project when merging from a fork

fields.description:
I have a small Git repository, using Atlassian Stash. The repo has bout 250 files, not much history, and the files are all small - total repo size is about 10MB.

Git pull (returning just "Already up-to-date") in many cases over 8 seconds.

With GIT_TRACE set, the following is shown:

    23:35:25.109710 git.c:555               trace: exec: 'git-pull'
    23:35:25.109745 run-command.c:351       trace: run_command: 'git-pull'
    23:35:25.122176 git.c:346               trace: built-in: git 'rev-parse' '--git-dir'

    23:35:25.132926 git.c:346               trace: built-in: git 'rev-parse' '--show-toplevel'

    23:35:25.148347 run-command.c:351       trace: run_command: 'ssh' '-p' '7999' 'git@smsvcs' 'git-upload-pack '\''/srm/srm.git'\'''
    23:35:31.758436 run-command.c:351       trace: run_command: 'rev-list' '--objects' '--stdin' '--not' '--all' '--quiet'
    23:35:31.761165 run-command.c:351       trace: run_command: 'rev-list' '--objects' '--stdin' '--not' '--all'
    23:35:31.761307 exec_cmd.c:129          trace: exec: 'git' 'rev-list' '--objects' '--stdin' '--not' '--all'
    23:35:31.762459 git.c:346               trace: built-in: git 'rev-list' '--objects' '--stdin' '--not' '--all'
    23:35:33.806938 run-command.c:351       trace: run_command: 'gc' '--auto'

The biggest delay seems to happen at 23:35:25.148347, while it's running git-upload-pack over SSH (it takes over 6.5 seconds).

    test

fields.summary: After upgrade stash won't start crashes.

fields.description:
Consider following situation:

1. there are more than one pull requests concurrently waiting for merge.
2. these pull requests could be handled by command line git with fast-forward, no conflicts at all.

Stash's current behavior is:

a. the first pull request could be merged
b. all subsequent pull requests would FAILED merge
c. annoying information dialog appear to ask 'do refresh'
d. even no way to 'decline' the pull request before 'do refresh'

---------

Stash's behavior should align with command line git to handle (no conflict) 3 way merge as handy as possible.
fields.summary: Provide the option for Stash to perform Implicit Merges

fields.description:
Our Stash instance has > 1000+ user licenses in a 5000+ person company. Our directory in Stash is: LDAP -> JIRA(with Crowd) -> Stash. When needing to change a single person's global permissions to a new setting, I must load several pages and search for the user (example: a person changes organizations and is now a Stash administrator after earlier just being a User). 

Permissions are not shown on the User page, nor is it possible to change the permissions on the User page. Clicking "Change Permissions" takes me to the unwieldy permissions page. 

It would be incredibly helpful to be able to make these changes and see the information on the Users page, rather than having to deal with the multiple pages and searching using ctrl/cmd + f.
fields.summary: Stash license and permissions available in Users area

fields.description:
When looking through pull requests, it is common to have small issues that you would like to have fixed, and leave comments in place for them to be fixed, "This line is missing.. ", comments like that. It would be nice to be able to have the task text use a sub-section of the comment text to make task creation less mundane.

I searched before creating this suggestion and found this ticket STASH-7531.

Similar request to what was mentioned in the description of that ticket, instead of adding formatting options to Create Task, just default the text to be a short version of the comment, even something as simple as a hard character limit.

The alternative would be allow a user to create a task without first creating a comment to attach it to, so that the amount of duplicate text is reduced.
fields.summary: Create Task on Comment by default populates a short plain-text version of comment

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of Oct 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone, 

Thanks for your feedback on this suggestion. [Bitbucket Server and Data Center 7.7|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/bitbucket-server-7-7-release-notes-1026037684.html#BitbucketServer7.7releasenotes-draftcomments] adds the ability to add comments as drafts during the code review. You can review and publish them at once at the end of the code review.

Give this a try and let us know your feedback.

Cheers,
 Imran Khan
 Product Manager - Bitbucket Server and Data Center
{panel}
 

*Original description:*

It is a common workflow (especially with reviewboard) to make many comments as drafts, review and edit them, then submit them at the end. Users are very confused and annoyed at losing this feature (we are attempting to move to stash from stupid git + reviewboard).

This feature was mentioned briefly in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-4244 but never got addressed beyond the scope of the original request (which was a bug in the current draft implementation, which is more about not losing comments when your 100-tabs firefox session crashes).

This is *really* important to us and probably many other people as well. I'd like to know if you guys will do it, and if you will, when. And if not, I'd like some guidance how I might write a plugin to do it (your welcome =).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please allow comment drafts to be queued up, edited, then published atomically
"Ignore whitespace" option ignores too much

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As of Java 1.8u51+ (also 1.7.0_85+ and 1.6.0_101+) making SSL connections to an IP address is no longer allowed.  Previously the JVM would do a reverse lookup of the hostname using the IP then complete the connection using that hostname.  This was a security vulnerability because an attacker that gained control of DNS 
could route traffic to their own server.  This change is a security feature of Java.

We have found there is a problem with the way Java creates LDAPS connections.  The way Socket.createSocket() is used results in an SSLSocket without the hostname set in it.  This results in use of an IP address to make the connection and since this is no longer allowed the connection fails.  We have reported this problem to Oracle and also forwarded the information to the Java security dev list: http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/security-dev/2015-September/012845.html .

Because of this _*existing LDAPS connections are broken*_ and users from that user directory are unable to login including non-local administrators.

This will affect any customer using secure LDAP that upgrades the JVM.  Secure LDAP is very common to protect passwords on the internal network, particularly in enterprise environments.

h3. Environment
* Any version of Stash using one of the noted Java versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a user directory using a secure LDAP connection
# Upgrade the JDK to a noted Java version.


h3. Expected Results

Logins and LDAP syncs should work as normal.

h3. Actual Results

Users will be unable to authenticate and LDAP syncs will fail.

Errors like this will occur in the logs: {code:borderStyle=solid}
2015-07-22 12:43:05,896 WARN  [http-bio-443-exec-1] @1SDVDDx763x1x0 XXXXX "POST /j_stash_security_check HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.s.PluginAuthenticationProvider Could not authenticate XXXXX; authentication by com.atlassian.stash.stash-authentication:crowdHttpAuthHandler failed
com.atlassian.stash.user.AuthenticationSystemException: The remote authentication server is not available. Please try again later.
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.crowd.RiotPolice.authenticate(RiotPolice.java:113) ~[stash-service-impl-3.11.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.user.DefaultUserService.authenticate(DefaultUserService.java:108) ~[stash-service-impl-3.11.1.jar:na]
...
	... 21 common frames omitted
Caused by: org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not create DirContext instance for transaction; nested exception is org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636 [Root exception is javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found]
	at org.springframework.transaction.compensating.support.AbstractCompensatingTransactionManagerDelegate.doBegin(AbstractCompensatingTransactionManagerDelegate.java:90) ~[spring-ldap-core-2.0.2.RELEASE.jar:2.0.2.RELEASE]
...
	... 22 common frames omitted
Caused by: org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636 [Root exception is javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found]
	at org.springframework.ldap.support.LdapUtils.convertLdapException(LdapUtils.java:108)
...
	... 39 common frames omitted
Caused by: javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.<init>(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.<init>(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 43 common frames omitted
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found
	at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.fatal(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 58 common frames omitted
Caused by: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found
	at sun.security.util.HostnameChecker.matchIP(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 67 common frames omitted
{code}

h3. Workaround 

*Option 1: Add JVM startup parameter {{-Djdk.tls.trustNameService=true}}*

This reverts back to the older Java behavior while preserving all the other security related changes in the newer Java release.

Your LDAP data will still be encrypted.  The risk is described by Oracle in their explanation of the change at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u51-relnotes-2587590.html :
{quote}If an application does need to perform reverse name lookup for raw IP addresses in SSL/TLS connections, and encounter endpoint identification compatibility issue, System property "jdk.tls.trustNameService" can be used to switch on reverse name lookup. Note that if the name service is not trustworthy, enabling reverse name lookup may be susceptible to MITM attacks.{quote}

*Option 2: Under the LDAP connection "Advanced Settings" set "Secure SSL" to disabled*

As stated in the UI this will disable all verification of the SSL certificate.  Your LDAP data will still be encrypted.

(!) This workaround may represent a greater vulnerability as any SSL cert could be substituted with no need to compromise a DNS server.
fields.summary: Secure LDAP connections are broken when using Java 1.8u51+, 1.7.0_85+ and 1.6.0_101+

fields.description:
The user page for any user should list all Pull requests for that user.

Would be great to just re-use the UI from the pull-requests page (tabs for open/merged/declined, columns for id, title, reviewers, source, destination, updated date).

Could work across repos if you and that user have multiple repos in common.  Could add a dropdown at the top to filter to a single repo.
fields.summary: View all (merged, unmerged) pull requests for any user
Unknown MarketPlace ping on /admin/clustering

fields.description:
To add or remove a user or group from a branch permission setting, you must first GET from the /restricted and /permitted endpoints, manipulate the user or group arrays, and then PUT the updated definition to /restricted endpoint.  Three API calls for one simple action.

Compare this with Crowd's endpoints for group membership, where you can add or remove users or groups with a single API call.

I've mitigated the complexity by writing library code that encapsulates the add user, add group, remove user, and remove group actions into separate methods, but that can't fix the inefficiency.
fields.summary: Branch permissions REST API inefficient and overcomplicated

fields.description:
There are times where our software managers want to (temporarily) prevent changes from being committed and/or merged into a branch.  

To do this, I would like to be able to remove all users or groups from the repo's branch permission settings. WIth no users or groups, no one should be able to make changes.  Unfortunately, Stash does not allow this.  An inelegant workaround is to replace valid users with a placeholder service account when we want to restrict access.  But that's not really satisfying the requirement, as theoretically that service account could make changes to the branch.
fields.summary: Should be able to create branch permissions with no users or groups

fields.description:
Pushing a commit in a separate branch with a commit message:

badass commit 💯

Causes an error to occur when loading the branch listing.
fields.summary: Adding UTF-8 in a commit message causes an error when loading branches

fields.description:
If i activate the number of requiered builds all posted builds are evaluated.
I need a setting that only the lasts builds are evaluated.
fields.summary: Workflow -> Pull Request: Setting for the requied Build

fields.description:
When ssh is enabled, stash by default generates ssh-url's when using the "Checkout in Sourcetree" option. This is not always desirable.
Possible improvements:
* Allow the user to choose the protocol when checking out
* Allow the admin to select which protocols are enabled. If more than one is enabled, allow the user to choose which protocol he wants.
* Allow the user to configure in his preferences which protocol he wants to use.

This relates to SRCTREE-1868
fields.summary: Choose protocol to use for checkout in SourceTree
Inbox: When there are more than 5 reviewers, clicking on the number badge doesn't show the dropdown

fields.description: When I'm viewing a diff in Stash in Chrome and Firefox on OS X with a touchpad with inertial scrolling enabled, Stash does something that changes the acceleration of that inertial scrolling. This causes scrolling to behave differently—and, in comparison with every other Web page and app on my Mac, unpredictably. Please either provide an option to disable this or remove it.
fields.summary: Stash changes inertial scrolling acceleration on OS X

fields.description: Favorite project are only shown on dashboard for users with Admin rights.
fields.summary: Project favorites not shown on dashboard

fields.description:
Using the Stash REST API and sending POST or PUT requests, if the JSON payload is not formated correctly the Stash server returns HTTP 500 instead of HTTP 400.

* STEPS TO REPRODUCE
curl  -H "Authorization: Basic ..." -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X PUT -d ' "{hook-url-0" : "some-url"}' 'https://stash.example.com/rest/api/1.0/projects/{projectKey}/repos/{repositorySlug}/settings/hooks/{hookKey}/enabled

Note that the payload is not correct JSON.


* RESULTS
Stash returns
 HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
 {
    "errors": [
        {
            "context": null,
            "exceptionName": null,
            "message": "An error occurred while processing the request. Check the server logs for more information."
        }
    ]
}


Stash should return,
 400 Bad Request
fields.summary: Malformed JSON should return HTTP 400, not HTTP 500

fields.description:
When clicking a link that I don't have access to I get a skull and crossbones with a 401.  I believe it should be a 403

401 == retry with authentication
403 == we know who you are, and you are not allowed to see this, do not retry
fields.summary: custom error page shows 401 when it should show 403

fields.description:
Hello!
I have this problem: after I declined the pull request, I couldn't execute these command's: 
1. /usr/bin/git fetch --progress origin +refs/pull-requests/118/from:refs/pull-requests/118/from
The error is: fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/pull-requests/118/from
2. /usr/bin/git fetch --progress origin +refs/pull-requests/118/merge:refs/pull-requests/118/merge
The error is: fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/pull-requests/118/merge

When I reopen pull request these command can be done.

This is the problem, because we have build in TeamCity, which updating sources from VCS and execute these command before starting execute build steps.
And in build we have error: 
Failed to start build #260 in branch 118/from at 17 Aug 15 09:09 on host
Failed to perform checkout on agent: '/usr/bin/git fetch --progress origin +refs/pull-requests/118/from:refs/pull-requests/118/from' command failed.
stderr: fatal: Couldn't find remote ref refs/pull-requests/118/from

The Stash documentation on pull requests does not detail in any way what exactly happens when you 'decline' a pull request.
fields.summary: cant git fetch refs/pull-requests/<number>/from(or merge) after decline

fields.description:
Hi,

Some of our plugins are listening to PluginLicenseCheckEvent and depend on it to enable/disable some dynamic modules, however it looks like the latest versions of the UPM (2.19.2+) are not triggering that event anymore.

Has this behaviour been changed? Is there a way to get access to the Javadocs corresponding to the latest versions of the UPM to know which is the right event to listen to?

I would have liked to create this issue in the UPM project, but I don't seem to be able to do that. I have chosen the Stash project simply because this can affect Stash add-ons, but it also affects Jira add-ons.

Thanks

PS. I posted the question in AA too: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24642291/pluginlicensecheckevent-not-triggered-anymore
fields.summary: PluginLicenseCheckEvent not triggered anymore?

fields.description:
Disabling SSH access keys systemwide prevents project and repository Access Keys from being added, but any project and repository Access Keys created while SSH access keys *are* enabled remain active after SSH access keys are later disabled.  Disabling SSH access keys systemwide should prevent any existing project and repository access keys from being used.

This issue only affects project and repository Access Keys.  Ordinary user SSH keys continue to work regardless of the setting of the system "SSH access keys" option.
fields.summary: Project and repository Access Keys created when SSH access keys enabled systemwide remain active after SSH access keys are disabled

fields.description: GitHub and Stash has different behaviour for nested lists. Four spaces in Stash and two spaces in GitHub. Will be nice to have flexible determination of nested lists. To support easy migration from GitHub to Stash.
fields.summary: Support for Markdown nested lists indented by two spaces

fields.description:
The [Web UI API|https://developer.atlassian.com/stash/docs/latest/reference/web-ui-api.html] page documents all the details of how to modify the Stash UI, but we don't actually include the basics of how to get JS and CSS onto a page.

We should add more documentation around the basics of UI plugins in Stash on that page, for example the {{webResourceManager_requireResource}} and {{webResourceManager_requireResourcesForContext}} functions in Soy, or how to use the {{PageBuilderService}}.
fields.summary: Document how to add JS and CSS to a Soy template
